SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc42
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.view

Class GameTerminal

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.gc42.view.GameTerminal
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewController, Serializable
public class GameTerminal extends javafx.application.Application implements ViewController
This class handles the whole TUI behavior and output system. All the TUI is contained inside this class. All that's needed to run a TUI is to call .start() on a GameTerminal object.
See Also:

    • addToActionQueue

      public void addToActionQueue(Runnable runnable)
      Adds an action inside the Queue. Actions are executed one by one from this Queue, so this is how a new one can be added.
      Parameters:
      runnable - the Code to execute

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws Exception
      Starts the TUI
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage for this application, onto which the application scene can be set. Applications may create other stages, if needed, but they will not be primary stages. THIS STAGE WILL NOT BE SHOWN
      Throws:
      Exception - if any issue occurs

    • showSecretObjectivesSelectionDialog

      public void showSecretObjectivesSelectionDialog()
      Asks the User to choose between 2 Objective Cards. The Cards are shown as ASCII art or Emojis based on the Graphics Mode. The Objectives' Names and Descriptions are also printed. Handles the User's inputs: 1 or 2 are accepted, others are handled as errors.
      Specified by:
      showSecretObjectivesSelectionDialog in interface ViewController

    • showStarterCardSelectionDialog

      public void showStarterCardSelectionDialog()
      Asks the User to pick which Side he wants to play the Starter Card. Both Sides are printed, in ASCII art or with Emojis based on the Graphics Mode. Handles the User's inputs: f (front) or b (back) are accepted, others are handled as errors.
      Specified by:
      showStarterCardSelectionDialog in interface ViewController

    • showTokenSelectionDialog

      public void showTokenSelectionDialog()
      Asks the User to pick one of the 4 Tokens. All Tokens are always shown: if a Token is not available, it will be printed as "already taken!". Tokens are visually printed in Unicode characters or Emojis, depending on the Graphics Mode. Unavailable Token can't be picked: if the User inputs a number corresponding to an unavailable Token, the input will be handled as an error.
      Specified by:
      showTokenSelectionDialog in interface ViewController

    • getOwner

      public int getOwner()
      Returns the playerID of the Player using this ViewController.
      Specified by:
      getOwner in interface ViewController
      Returns:
      the playerID

    • askToDrawOrGrab

      public void askToDrawOrGrab()
      Prints the 2 Decks and the 4 Cards on the table (Slots) and asks the user to Draw or Grab from any of those. The Deck's top Card's Back Side is printed graphically. The Slot Card's Front Side is printed as well. All those Cards are printed in ASCII art or with Emojis, based on the Graphics Mode. User inputs are handled as well. Correct inputs are translated in Server Messages to DRAW or GRAB a Card.
      Specified by:
      askToDrawOrGrab in interface ViewController

    • notifyGameIsStarting

      public void notifyGameIsStarting()
      Specified by:
      notifyGameIsStarting in interface ViewController

    • notifyDeckChanged

      public void notifyDeckChanged(CardType type)
      Specified by:
      notifyDeckChanged in interface ViewController

    • notifySlotCardChanged

      public void notifySlotCardChanged(CardType type, int slot)
      Specified by:
      notifySlotCardChanged in interface ViewController

    • notifyPlayersPointsChanged

      public void notifyPlayersPointsChanged(Token token, int newPoints)
      Shows the updated Ranking of all Player's points
      Specified by:
      notifyPlayersPointsChanged in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      token - the Token of the Player who updated its Points.
      newPoints - the updated Points' value

    • notifyNumberOfPlayersChanged

      public void notifyNumberOfPlayersChanged()
      Notifies the number of Players in the Game has changed, both increased and decreased. Prints a list of all the Players inside the Game. This method is only call if the User created the Game. It allows him to know how many Players have joined, so that he can start the Game whenever he wants. This method also asks the User to type "s" to start the Game. Invalid inputs are handled.
      Specified by:
      notifyNumberOfPlayersChanged in interface ViewController

    • notifyPlayersTokenChanged

      public void notifyPlayersTokenChanged(int playerID)
      Notifies the User that another Player has picked a Token. Updates the List of available Tokens. If the User hasn't picked a Token yet, it then adds the showTokenSelectionDialog() method to the Queue once again, so that the User can choose a Token with an updated view of all the Tokens still available.
      Specified by:
      notifyPlayersTokenChanged in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      playerID - the Player who picked the Token.

    • notifyPlayersPlayAreaChanged

      public void notifyPlayersPlayAreaChanged(int playerID)
      Intercepts the Server's message that a Player has played a Card. Updates the playArea matrix with the new Card in the right place. If the playerID is the same as the User, it prints the updated playArea matrix. If it's another playerID, it only updates the matrix, but it doesn't print it.
      Specified by:
      notifyPlayersPlayAreaChanged in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      playerID - the Player who placed the Card.

    • notifyPlayersHandChanged

      public void notifyPlayersHandChanged(int playerID)
      Intercepts the Server Message that someone's Hand has been updated. If the playerId is the same as the User, it prints the updated Hand; otherwise, this method does nothing. Updates are shown only when the Hand goes from 2 to 3 Cards => The initial updated are ignored.
      Specified by:
      notifyPlayersHandChanged in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      playerID - the Player whose Hand was updated.

    • notifyHandCardWasFlipped

      public void notifyHandCardWasFlipped(int playedID, int cardID)
      Intercepts the Server Message that someone's Card was flipped. If the playerID is the same as the User, it prints the updated Hand, otherwise it ignores it.
      Specified by:
      notifyHandCardWasFlipped in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      playedID - the Player whose Card was flipped.
      cardID - the Card that was flipped.

    • notifyPlayersObjectiveChanged

      public void notifyPlayersObjectiveChanged(int playerID)
      Intercepts the Server Message that someone's Secret Objective has been updated. If the playerID is the same as the User, it prints the Secret Objective, otherwise it's ignored.
      Specified by:
      notifyPlayersObjectiveChanged in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      playerID - the Player whose Secret Objective has been updated.

    • notifyCommonObjectivesChanged

      public void notifyCommonObjectivesChanged()
      Intercepts the Server Message that the 2 Common Objectives have been updated and prints them.
      Specified by:
      notifyCommonObjectivesChanged in interface ViewController

    • notifyTurnChanged

      public void notifyTurnChanged()
      Intercepts the Server Message that the Turn changed. Asks the Server whose Turn it is now: if it's the User's one, it adds the play() method to the action Queue.
      Specified by:
      notifyTurnChanged in interface ViewController

    • showWaitingForServerDialog

      public void showWaitingForServerDialog()
      Prints the "Waiting for Server..." text.
      Specified by:
      showWaitingForServerDialog in interface ViewController

    • getReady

      public void getReady(int numberOfPlayers)
      Intercepts the Server Message that the Game is starting. If the User created the Game, it sets the status to READY. In all cases, it sets the Player's status to READY.
      Specified by:
      getReady in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - the number of Players inside the Game.

    • showRanking

      public void showRanking()
      Prints the current Player's Ranking, ordered by Points.

    • login

      public void login()
      Asks the User to pick a Network Mode between RMI and Socket. If the input is accepted, it calls askForIPAddress(). Handles invalid inputs.

    • notifyLastTurn

      public void notifyLastTurn() throws RemoteException
      Notifies the User that this is the Last Turn before the end of the Game
      Specified by:
      notifyLastTurn in interface ViewController
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a connection error.

    • notifyEndGame

      public void notifyEndGame(ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> points) throws RemoteException
      Notifies the User that the Game has ended. It also shows all the Player's Points acquired during the match, as well as the Points that were given from the Secret Objective and the 2 Common Objectives, plus the sum of all of them. Finally, it shows who is/are the Winner/s.
      Specified by:
      notifyEndGame in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      points - an ArrayList containing all the data (taken from the Server)
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of a connection error.

      Specified by:
      notifyNewMessage in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      message - the new Message received
